00052 SteepestDescent::SteepestDescent(ObjectiveFunction* of) 
00053   : VertexMover(of),
00054     PatchSetUser(true),
00055     projectGradient(false) //,
00056     //cosineStep(false)

00068 
00069 void SteepestDescent::optimize_vertex_positions(PatchData &pd, 
00070                                                 MsqError &err)
00071 {
00072   MSQ_FUNCTION_TIMER( "SteepestDescent::optimize_vertex_positions" );
00073 
00074   const int SEARCH_MAX = 100;
00075   const double c1 = 1e-4;
00076   //std::vector<Vector3D> unprojected(pd.num_free_vertices()); 
00077   std::vector<Vector3D> gradient(pd.num_free_vertices()); 
00078   bool feasible=true;//bool for OF values
00079   double min_edge_len, max_edge_len;
00080   double step_size=0, original_value=0, new_value=0;
00081   double norm_squared=0;
00082   PatchDataVerticesMemento* pd_previous_coords;
00083   TerminationCriterion* term_crit=get_inner_termination_criterion();
00084   OFEvaluator& obj_func = get_objective_function_evaluator();
00085   
00086     // get vertex memento so we can restore vertex coordinates for bad steps.
00087   pd_previous_coords = pd.create_vertices_memento( err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00088     // use auto_ptr to automatically delete memento when we exit this function
00089   std::auto_ptr<PatchDataVerticesMemento> memento_deleter( pd_previous_coords );
00090 
00091     // Evaluate objective function.
00092     //
00093     // Always use 'update' version when beginning optimization so that
00094     // if doing block coordinate descent the OF code knows the set of
00095     // vertices we are modifying during the optimziation (the subset
00096     // of the mesh contained in the current patch.)  This has to be
00097     // done up-front because typically an OF will just store the portion
00098     // of the OF value (e.g. the numeric contribution to the sum for an
00099     // averaging OF) for the initial patch.
00100   feasible = obj_func.update( pd, original_value, gradient, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00101     // calculate gradient dotted with itself
00102   norm_squared = length_squared( gradient );
00103   
00104     //set an error if initial patch is invalid.
00105   if(!feasible){
00106     MSQ_SETERR(err)("SteepestDescent passed invalid initial patch.",
00107                     MsqError::INVALID_ARG);
00108     return;
00109   }
00110 
00111     // use edge length as an initial guess for for step size
00112   pd.get_minmax_edge_length( min_edge_len, max_edge_len );
00113   //step_size = max_edge_len / std::sqrt(norm_squared);
00114   //if (!finite(step_size))  // zero-length gradient
00115   //  return;
00116 //  if (norm_squared < DBL_EPSILON)
00117 //    return;
00118   if (norm_squared >= DBL_EPSILON)
00119     step_size = max_edge_len / std::sqrt(norm_squared) * pd.num_free_vertices();
00120 
00121     // The steepest descent loop...
00122     // We loop until the user-specified termination criteria are met.
00123   while (!term_crit->terminate()) {
00124     MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "Iteration " << term_crit->get_iteration_count() << std::endl;
00125     MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  original_value: " << original_value << std::endl;
00126     MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  grad norm suqared: " << norm_squared << std::endl;
00127 
00128       // Save current vertex coords so that they can be restored if
00129       // the step was bad.
00130     pd.recreate_vertices_memento( pd_previous_coords, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00131 
00132       // Reduce step size until it satisfies Armijo condition
00133     int counter = 0;
00134     for (;;) {
00135       if (++counter > SEARCH_MAX || step_size < DBL_EPSILON) {
00136         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "    o  No valid step found.  Giving Up." << std::endl;
00137         return;
00138       }
00139       
00140       // Move vertices to new positions.
00141       // Note: step direction is -gradient so we pass +gradient and 
00142       //       -step_size to achieve the same thing.
00143       pd.move_free_vertices_constrained( arrptr(gradient), gradient.size(), -step_size, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00144       // Evaluate objective function for new vertices.  We call the
00145       // 'evaluate' form here because we aren't sure yet if we want to
00146       // keep these vertices.  Until we call 'update', we have the option
00147       // of reverting a block coordinate decent objective function's state
00148       // to that of the initial vertex coordinates.  However, for block
00149       // coordinate decent to work correctly, we will need to call an
00150       // 'update' form if we decide to keep the new vertex coordinates.
00151       feasible = obj_func.evaluate( pd, new_value, err ); 
00152       if (err.error_code() == err.BARRIER_VIOLATED) 
00153         err.clear();  // barrier violated does not represent an actual error here
00154       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00155       MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "    o  step_size: " << step_size << std::endl;
00156       MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "    o  new_value: " << new_value << std::endl;
00157 
00158       if (!feasible) {
00159         // OF value is invalid, decrease step_size a lot
00160         step_size *= 0.2;
00161       }
00162       else if (new_value > original_value - c1 * step_size * norm_squared) {
00163         // Armijo condition not met.
00164         step_size *= 0.5;
00165       }
00166       else {
00167         // Armijo condition met, stop
00168         break;
00169       }
00170       
00171       // undo previous step : restore vertex coordinates
00172       pd.set_to_vertices_memento( pd_previous_coords, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00173     }
00174    
00175       // Re-evaluate objective function to get gradient.
00176       // Calling the 'update' form here incorporates the new vertex 
00177       // positions into the 'accumulated' value if we are doing a 
00178       // block coordinate descent optimization.
00179     obj_func.update(pd, original_value, gradient, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00180     if (projectGradient) {
00181       //if (cosineStep) {
00182       //  unprojected = gradient;
00183       //  pd.project_gradient( gradient, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00184       //  double dot = inner_product( arrptr(gradient), arrptr(unprojected), gradient.size() );
00185       //  double lensqr1 = length_squared( gradient );
00186       //  double lensqr2 = length_squared( unprojected );
00187       //  double cossqr = dot * dot / lensqr1 / lensqr2;
00188       //  step_size *= sqrt(cossqr);
00189       //}
00190       //else {
00191         pd.project_gradient( gradient, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00192       //}      
00193     }
00194       
00195       // Update terination criterion for next iteration.
00196       // This is necessary for efficiency.  Some values can be adjusted
00197       // for each iteration so we don't need to re-caculate the value
00198       // over the entire mesh.
00199     term_crit->accumulate_patch( pd, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00200     term_crit->accumulate_inner( pd, original_value, arrptr(gradient), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
00201       
00202       // Calculate initial step size for next iteration using step size 
00203       // from this iteration
00204     step_size *= norm_squared;
00205     norm_squared = length_squared( gradient );
00206 //    if (norm_squared < DBL_EPSILON)
00207 //      break;
00208   if (norm_squared >= DBL_EPSILON)
00209     step_size /= norm_squared;
00210   }
00211 }
00212 
00213 void SteepestDescent::terminate_mesh_iteration(PatchData &/*pd*/, MsqError &/*err*/)
00214 {
00215   //  cout << "- Executing SteepestDescent::iteration_complete()\n";
00216 }

00218 void SteepestDescent::cleanup()
